instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .
definitions.PPBUS_3GH: What is PPBUS_3GH? PPBUS_3GH is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. If you see someone type PPBUS_3GH assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard ant track pad not working
threads.message:
no water damage.
<CHIP>U4803</CHIP>/L4800 was blow up. i was replace them and make some jumpers.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_CS_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL> -star on 5v and immediately down to 0v and stay there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard ant track pad not working
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground there, with trackpad connected.
If no bad value, replace L4800 with tiny wire..

threads.message:
Looks like poltergeist.
If you lost 20V on USB-C port after touching the board, could be an induced problem.

Missing 1V1 LDO now, points to <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200, <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>/90, or something on their area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard ant track pad not working
threads.message:
Shouldn't be USB-C issue, as the input power switches to 20V correctly.

I suspect more for a SMC sensor issue.
But you've said didnt' start in SMC bypass mode, very strange...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard ant track pad not working
threads.message: i did reset SMC but how do i do bypass SMC with this mac model?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard ant track pad not working
threads.message:
Many times explained on the forum and Google also helps.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?client=firefox-b-d&ei=W5HsX7v_Mc-T8gLsv6rgBQ&q=macbook+smc+bypass+mode&oq=macbook+smc+bypass+mode&gs_lcp=CgZwc3ktYWIQAzIECAAQEzoHCAAQRxCwAzoECAAQQzoICAAQsQMQgwE6BQgAELEDOggILhCxAxCDAToICAAQxwEQowI6CwgAELEDEMcBEKMCOgIIADoFCC4QsQM6BwgAELEDEEM6BAgAEAo6BggAEBYQHjoICAAQFhAeEBNQjpTYS1jLy9hLYNbM2EtoAXACeACAAe8BiAGYEZIBBjIwLjIuMZgBAKABAaoBB2d3cy13aXrIAQjAAQE&sclient=psy-ab&ved=0ahUKEwj7mP3n9_XtAhXPiVwKHeyfClwQ4dUDCAw&uact=5[/URL]

BTW, once battery and charger are both removed, SMC reset is done; no need to do it through keyboard.
But is not the same as starting in SMC bypass mode!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard ant track pad not working
threads.message:
If no other coil from the board has the same value as in <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, you are lucky; check that.
You can then use voltage injection method.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard ant track pad not working
threads.message:
check just the big coils? like L7410/20/30?
how much V can i injunct? i was injunct 1v but nothing get hot..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard ant track pad not working
threads.message:
You can increase voltage at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, untill something gets hot.
Set amp limit to max for lab PSU.
Be sure first, no other coil has the same value to ground!!!

Burnt <CHIP>U7370</CHIP> could damaged CPU, because of overvoltage...
